Definition: unique identifier for a single MMM timeseries.
Notes: if aggregating accross multiple timeseries IDs, take care with currency conversion

Definition: unique, anonymous identifier for an eCommerce brand
the top-level category of the highest selling products
the sub-category of the highest selling products
at least one of Google, Meta, and/or Tiktok
Notes: spend from listed sources may not be present in all of the timeseries for a given brand, given different utilisation by territory

Definition: the organisation's territory with the highest average daily orders
values include mult-country "All Territories" and country-level roll-ups.
Notes: some orgs will have multiple territory spits, where there is sufficient data available to do so

Definition: currency for monetary fields
Notes: when territory_name = "all territories" we use the currency of the brand's primary territory

Definition: observation date
Notes: each timeseries has a minimum of 449 sequential days

Definition: number of web purchases for new customers, i.e. acquisitions
number of units purchased by new customers
new customer total value of merchandise before discount
new customer total discount value
Notes: discount rates are only available for completed purchases, take care to avoid data leakage if using this as a control variable

Definition: number of web purchases for all customers
number of units purchased by all customers
total value of merchandise before discount
total discount value
Notes: discount rates are only available for completed purchases, take care to avoid data leakage if using this as a control variable

Definition: google spend on (non-branded) paid search
Notes: this is all spend on this channel, regardless of its purpose.

Definition: google spend on shopping ads
google spend on performance max campaigns
google spend on display ads
google spend on video ads
meta spend on facebook ads
meta spend on instagram ads
meta spend on ads from other platforms
tiktok spend
ad clicks for each channel with spend
ad impressions for each channel with spend
web traffic from "non-paid" channels
Notes: spend from affiliates and branded search are not tracked, however traffic from these sources is recorded
